text: When I feel fear about losing love, I notice it and choose to build security instead of letting anxiety control me.
During moments when love is offered, I notice any resistance and choose to receive it with openness instead.
When I feel anxiety rising about the relationship, I pause and breathe before letting fear drive my behavior.
I let fear of losing love create constant anxiety that affects my relationships and my peace.
When I notice fear of receiving love, I recognize it and choose to open up gradually instead of shutting down.
I see when relationship anxiety is based on old fears rather than present reality, and I choose to separate them.
When I feel the pull to test or push away love, I notice it and choose to trust and stay present instead.
I let fear of receiving love prevent me from accepting and experiencing deep connection.
When I notice anxiety about the relationship, I recognize it and choose to address it calmly instead of reacting.
I recognize when my fear comes from past experiences rather than the current relationship, and I respond accordingly.
When I feel the urge to protect myself from love, I notice it and choose to let love in gradually instead.
I let relationship anxiety prevent me from maintaining connections without constantly fearing I'll lose love.
When I notice worry about the relationship escalating, I interrupt it early by staying grounded and present.
I see when fear is blocking me from accepting love, and I choose to work through the fear instead of avoiding it.
When I feel the pull to sabotage love due to fear, I notice it and choose to nurture the connection instead.
I let fear of losing or receiving love control my behavior and prevent me from experiencing secure relationships.
When I notice anxiety about love, I pause and check whether it's coming from now or from old patterns.
I recognize when I'm pushing love away due to fear, and I choose to stay open and receive it instead.
When I feel the urge to protect myself from vulnerability, I notice it and choose to trust gradually instead.
I let relationship anxiety prevent me from accepting and receiving love without fear or constant worry.
